intro: Cassytha glabella f. glabella, commonly known as the glabrous cassytha, is a tropical vine belonging to the family Lauraceae. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairless. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
